title: @Riot Don't make Zeke's an AP item
body:
If you do, then the whole concept of an AD support is *completely dead*. 

Sure, it's not the most viable right now. But with Zeke's and Targons I like to have fun with {{champion:5}}  support, or other champs that can go AD if ahead and build tank if they don't. I'm sure other people have champs they play it with.  

If you remove that, there's no way AD support item *at all*. Kinda hard to justify that.

replies.body:
+1.  It'd be a pity for Riot to release yet another mana/mana regen + AP item.  Plus, 250 mana?  Who opens up the shop and decides that's the amount of mana that will make their build work?  For an item targeted at supports, it seems a bit foolish to ask those supports to plan 2 items to solve their mana problems (one of which being new Zeke's if supports are actually going to buy that).  The rest of the stats are still awkward too:  which supports want both AP and armor?  The tank supports don't want the AP, and the squishier supports don't often spring for armor (though they probably will when this drops).  

Lastly, as much as I don't want to bash Riot's new items (the problem is the REMOVAL of an item, not the ADDITION of one).... who the hell thought those stats on a buff would be healthy for the game?  They'll warp powercurves completely, water down the niche of buff-focused supports, and snowball games pretty hard.  Zeke's/Locket/Abyssal as flat auras already snowball to an extent, due to the multiplicative nature of stats, but a scaling buff just exaggerates it.  Now when you and the other support both build new Zeke's, but their ADC builds IE while yours doesn't, your Zeke's is now much weaker than theirs.  This will only further enforce IE as a must-buy ADC item.  **BUT AGAIN:  the main problem is that they're removing a harmless item to do all of this**.
The community has been demanding an AR item for utlity support fpr a while now.Seems like we finnaly got it,kinda...

just for what price...

nothing against an armor item for mage-supports, but why sacrifice Zeke's for it, and why that 50% crit steroid...
also, do we need another cdr item for supports? They really need an utillity mastery that converts overflowing cdr into something usefull...
and they always talk about "diversity" while they are actually removing it

You forgot about {{champion:201}} and {{champion:44}}. 

Braum gets a lot of health for his Q and as a tank.

Taric is amazing with this. Bonus for Q. Bonus for his already bonus on R.

The issue here is that bruiser don't have the "usual" characteristic needed by a support.
The support usually must: 
1) be able to protect their ADC.
2) be able to "endure" the harassing of a duo lane (This can be done by healing, being tanky, poking enough that harassing isn't safe anymore, or having a "threat zone" big enough that it's hard for the enemy to harass without stepping inside. Most supports have a combination of those things.)
3) Have a kit that allows them to be useful even on -0- gold

Without going into specific champions, the issue is that bruisers basically are never able to satisfy the third one.
Being a bruiser without items is... awful. You're at a fraction of your potential, your job should be to dive backlines but you can't inflict enough damage and quickly enough to do real damage, and not enough tankiness to survive.

I'm sure a lot of people will give me huge lists of games where they kicked asses and carried the game as, say, lee sin or rengar support. But the issue is, those are "troll" picks. They win because since they're never played, the enemy doesn't know how to play against them, and end up losing the lane, hard. They win because they balance the lack of farm by making the life of the enemy botlane a living hell. But if those picks started getting actually played... everyone would stop playing them, because once you know how to counter them, gg they stop bringing damage and bring very little utility in teamfight, so they become near useless.

A good {{champion:89}} Ult, or {{champion:53}} grab can be game-changing without requiring them to own a single item. That's why they're considered better as supports than any bruiser.

There are enough ad-champs that bring alot utillity with little gold.
J4 and Lee wouldn't have been high tier junglers through out nearly all seasons if they wouldn't bring great utillity even with low gold.
J4 has similar engage power to leona and a lot inbuilt tankiness while buffing the physical damage of his team quite well with q armorshred and E as-boost.
Gp also is suprisingly funktional with little gold(and with the Q bonus gold and support masteries, he can earn quite a bit)
His E+zekes is basically a BF for the entire team with MS and AS on top, while his ult has massive magical aoe base-damage.
With passive and Iceborn, he can also peel quite well.
And no, getting iceborn ans zekes on support gp isn't unrealistic, thats~5k gold, with FoM, boots and sightstone thats 9k gold.
In most games i play, supports end the game with 11-13k, so atleast 2k gold to spend on pinks and normal wards(i rarly see supports buying more than 10 stealth and 5 pinkwards in a game, which would be 1250g)

Also, ashe is a great support, ult for engage, passive slow for peel, even on aoe due W, E fr more vision, and with tBC, she can shred armor like a boss.
Her harresmpotential in lane also is really massive.

TL;DR: there are enough ad-champs that can work well on a support salary

If they made it a new item and gave the current live Zeke's a small buff or adjustment, that'd be different, but they're not. It's debatable if the new Zeke's has comparable alternatives stat-wise. There isn't really a good armor item for utility supports. Frozen heart kind of works, except that it can be an overload of armor when you don't have HP to back it up, and tanks very often pick it up themselves and take that option away from you. Having a low-cost glacial shroud item that I can get on Sona or Janna or Karma is giving me an option I don't have right now.

I'd also say Black Cleaver is pretty good as a comparable alternative. CDR, health, AD, and a team-assisting passive. Would probably be a superior purchase to Zeke's in most situations on someone like Jarvan support.

Maybe something that alludes to the duo nature of the new passive? 

I'm thinking something mushy like Zeke's Harmony or Zeke's Liason.

When I look at those champions, I ask myself "Which one really wants a Zeke?" and the answer I come up with is none of them. If ahead, most of them would like more damage than Zeke offers, and if behind, they'd rather have more tank than Zeke offers.

I suppose that you could use it with another half offensive/half defensive item, but then I think that there are still better of the half and half items.

I would argue not, sure now that {{item:3071}} grants 20% CDR Zeke's is less significant, however it's power lies in the aura moreso than it's raw stats. The fact two kill lane champions are botlane means much higher chances of having 3 or more AD champions on your team.

Whichever way you look at it, 60+ AD and 30%+ lifesteal are no joke come lategame. Even if it isn't being effective due to enemy stacking armor, it helps a lot killing objectives like baron and towers much faster. The lifesteal is often just icing on the cake.

To be honest, I wasn't even thinking about Cleaver when talking about the half defensive/half offensive items.

But really most AD champs would rather have the extra 30% pen than the 20 AD and 10% life steal.
Yeah but you don't buy it for yourself, it's a team buy like {{item:3105}}.

I love kill lanes but I gotta say one thing though:

As a kill lane support, Zeke's does not help me kill stuff. Phage, Brutalizer, Sheen and their products do. The only champ I run this item on is support GP (because of the aura not because it's AD), and even that I play as a 0 damage full utility support (which works by the way).

I think that's like saying GP's E does not help you kill stuff late game. I'd like to remind that the item gives two long swords to every nearby ally.

In total in a teamfight, Zeke's gives **100 AD** and **50% lifesteal**. The highest combination of both stats while granting enormous amounts of CDR and decent HP to the holder, so that they would stay alive and maintain the aura.

I think the item's purpose and design is pretty clear actually, it's just hard to appreciate for many people because it provides an "ok" amount of stats for everbody, similar to {{item:3105}}. Have you ever actually said "wow, {{champion:115}} is not dealing a lot of damage to our team, the aegis aura sure is working!!"

Not really, it is just 20 MR and is unlikely to be very noticible but it exists and you have to be aware of what it does. Just like having {{champion:74}} 's passive on your team, you might not feel there is something but you are actually regenerating faster than the enemy team and factor it in as bonus hp, just like having potential unused shields in a teamfight {{champion:43}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:99}}.

Some minuscule things are difficult to see, but definitely make a big difference when put under the scope like that "Damage to Champions" graph at the end of the game.
If you play a kill lane, you might as well go full AD. You need to snowball anyway. The scaling with Zeke's is trash.
The game doesn't always end in 20 minutes, most kill lanes are ADCasters that benefit from HP and CDR making the item an attractive purchase given they can sacrifice an item slot.

I could say the same thing except bring up the heavy AP supports like {{champion:1}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:99}}  and how this item will really make them even more viable. ]

Supports need more variety in items if you ask me, and this is a great way to bring even more variety into the support role. Maybe riot could add a different item to bring up AD supports but this item belongs to those AP supports, let us have this please.

They can just add the item without replacing Zeke's with it.  MOST supports are AP (or tank) so don't act like we don't have options.  Nearly every support item is catered to AP.

And it doesn't "bring variety" to basically delete one of the most unique items in the game.

They are making items more tempting to supports that want to branch out to more ap heavy supports. I understand you AD supports wanting something but this is for the ap heavy supports, let us have this. It's so gold efficient so we don't have to build actual ap items when we could be building something to help our adc. 

I feel for you ad supports I really really do, but AP supports that can really shine will seriously be able to bring something to the table now. AD supports deserve an item, you're right. But this item is ours just let us have this. Hopefully riot will branch out and maybe make something more for AD supports in the future. But the people who want to play those off meta supports Like I mentioned will not be able to play those and not get flamed.

I'm not an AD support (usually, though I have done it); all of my favorite supports are AP (Nami, Lulu, Zyra, Sona, etc).  We already have plenty of options.  And this IS removing the item.  It changes literately EVERYTHING.  There are zero similarities between this item and the old herald, it's completely unrecognizable, it is for all intents and purposes the removal of Zeke's Herald.

And don't act like AP supports don't already shine.  ALL "viable" supports are either AP or tank.  Annie is probably one of the most AP-heavy supports and is also one of the top 5 (if not higher) at pretty much all levels of play, even the LCS.  I see her at least one or two game(s) everytime I watch the LCS.  And I've seen pretty much every mage as a support at one time or another, from Brand to Karthus to Veigar (as I recall there was even a Veigar support in the EU LCS last year or so).  And it's MUCH easier to bring one of those bot lane than ANY AD (even the one AD, Ashe, who is classified as a support).  I don't see how you can act like AP supports are suffering when they have literately ALWAYS been the main or the secondary option for a support.  You act like this change will make or break AP supports or that they won't be viable without it - that's just not true.  I definitely would like to have it, but I don't think it's right to replace Zeke's Herald with it.

Zeke's is pretty much the most unique item in the game.  I'd rather them just flat out delete it, name and all, then have them just turn it into yet another AP support item or support item with yet another active.  It just feels wrong to warp it into something unrecognizable, and to me there's no reason to do that.  They could easily just give this item a new name and keep the old Zeke's, as well (maybe even rework the old Zeke's a bit to make it more viable while at the same time keeping its identity).  Item diversity isn't created by deleting unique items or changing them beyond recognition to an item that will become a must-buy on some supports. "Must-buy" isn't "diverse".

"Riot, please don't make a support item into a better support item."

Oh, wait, you thought they intended it for bruisers?

It's more "Riot, don't take my spoon and turn it into a Chair."
Getting a new chair is nice, but you simply can't eat your soup with it.
plus I already have 3 other chairs and I really don't need another

It's not like turning a spoon into a chair, it's like turning a sundial into a digital clock with an alarm. Sure, the sundial is cool, and in perfect conditions, you can be proud that you know how to use it, but it's ultimately anachronistic and not very spectacular.

sundial into a clock would still preserve the original idea and just improve it, serveing still the same purpose.
The new Zeke's and the old one however have as much in common as a a spoon and a chair.

I wouldn't have a broblem if they would upgrade the sundail into a digital clock, but frankly, they exchange it for a lawnmower. Yes, a lawnmower is nice, more modern and probably also more valuable, but it simply doesn't serve the same purpose at all.
I'd rather keep my sundail in that case and buy an lawnmower in adition.

I don't want it as an AP sup...

Now I'm going to have to delay my build even longer to get an item that will only slightly benefit me... It's already hard to feel like I'm contributing much late game since my build is so far behind, now it's going to feel even worse. I'll have to stay leashed to my ADC and only act as a buff bot. Which sounds so rewarding...

I don't see why they have to change it.  Why not keep zekes and add in a whole new item #strategicdiversity
